spanishExample: ¿Sabías que esto era suyo?
englishTranslation: Did you know this was his?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Él no quiere que lo sepan.
englishTranslation: He doesn’t want them to know it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: El padre supo que esto era tuyo.
englishTranslation: The father found out that this was yours.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
supe: "knew / found out", "he/she/it knew / found out" (Saber, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Esa niña está con esa familia.
englishTranslation: That little girl is with that family.

spanishExample: Ese niño está seguro de que tú lo sabrías.
englishTranslation: That little boy is sure that you would know it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
sabrías: "would know", "you would know" (Saber, conditional, 2nd person)
seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar

spanishExample: He estado aquí desde la mañana, o sea, por tres horas.
englishTranslation: I’ve been here since this morning, that is, for three hours.
vocabIncluded: he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Iba hacia *the north,* o sea, hacia *Canada.*
englishTranslation: I was going toward the north, that is, toward Canada.
vocabIncluded: iba: "was going", "I was going" (Ir, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: La hermana y el papá de ese tipo fueron ahí.
englishTranslation: That guy’s sister and his dad went there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener

spanishExample: La madre y el bebé estaban aquí.
englishTranslation: The mother and the baby were here.

spanishExample: La niña *walked* desde ese lugar.
englishTranslation: The little girl walked from that place.

spanishExample: Mi madre *said* que puedo tener lo que quiera.
englishTranslation: My mother said I can have whatever I want.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Mi mamá *said* que la gente sabría que esto es mío.
englishTranslation: My mom said that the people would know this is mine.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
sabría: "would know", "he/she/it would know" (Saber, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Mi mamá y mi hermana quieren saber lo que sabíamos.
englishTranslation: My mom and my sister want to know what we knew.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases

spanishExample: No estoy segura de que sepa lo que tú sabes.
englishTranslation: I’m not sure(f) he knows what you know.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar

spanishExample: No *I think* que haya nadie aquí.
englishTranslation: I don’t think there is anyone here.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: No lo sabe; si lo supiera, estaría contra su hijo.
englishTranslation: He doesn’t know it; if he knew it, he would be against his son.
vocabIncluded: estaría: "would be", "he/she/it would be" (Estar, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Que yo sepa, hubo un problema ese día.
englishTranslation: As far as I know, there was a problem that day.
vocabIncluded: que yo sepa: "as far as I know" (idiom)

spanishExample: Que yo sepa, mi hijo no lo hizo.
englishTranslation: As far as I know, my son didn’t do it (m).
vocabIncluded: que yo sepa: "as far as I know" (idiom)

spanishExample: Quería que hubiera más gente.
englishTranslation: I wanted there to be more people.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hubiera: "there were to be" (Haber, past subjunctive, impersonal)

spanishExample: Quiere que sepamos de quién es el bebé.
englishTranslation: He wants us to know whose the baby is.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Quiero que él sepa qué tienes bajo *the bed.*
englishTranslation: I want him to know what you have under the bed.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
"qué" in an implied question, not an actual question

spanishExample: Quiero que sepas lo que papá tiene aquí.
englishTranslation: I want you to know what dad has here.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Sabemos que le *we’ll give* a nuestra hija lo que quiera.
englishTranslation: We know we’ll give our daughter whatever she wants.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
a, used in a "redundant indirect object", e.g. le hice un favor a la chica
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")

spanishExample: Sabrá que ella está en contra de ellos.
englishTranslation: He will know she is opposed to them.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
sabrá: "will know", "he/she/it will know" (Saber, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Sabré si lo hicieron sin él.
englishTranslation: I will know if they did it without him.
vocabIncluded: sabremos: "will know", "we will know" (Saber, future, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Sabremos si tendrá lo que quiera.
englishTranslation: We’ll know if he’ll have whatever he wants.
vocabIncluded: sabremos: "will know", "we will know" (Saber, future, 1st person plural)
tendrá: "will have", "he/she/it will have" (Tener, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Sabríamos si ese tipo estuviera aquí.
englishTranslation: We would know if that guy were here.
vocabIncluded: sabríamos: "would know", "we would know" (Saber, conditional, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Sé que el niño y su hermano sabrán qué hacer.
englishTranslation: I know that the boy and his brother will know what to do.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
"qué" in an implied question, not an actual question
sabrán: "will know", "they will know" (Saber, future, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Sea lo que sea, está sobre la casa.
englishTranslation: Whatever it is, it’s on top of the house.
vocabIncluded: sea lo que sea: "whatever it is" (idiom)

spanishExample: Sea lo que sea, lo *we’ll solve* como una familia.
englishTranslation: Whatever it is, we’ll solve it as a family.
vocabIncluded: sea lo que sea: "whatever it is" (idiom)

spanishExample: Si supieran hacerlo, no estaríamos aquí.
englishTranslation: If they knew how to do it, we wouldn’t be here.
vocabIncluded: estaríamos: "would be", "we would be" (Estar, conditional, 1st person plural)
supieran: "knew", "they knew" (Saber, past subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Si supieras *the lyrics,* podrías *sing.*
englishTranslation: If you knew the lyrics, you could sing.
vocabIncluded: podrías: "would be able", "you would be able" (Poder, conditional, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Su esposa dijo que estaría con su esposo.
englishTranslation: His wife said that she would be with her husband.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
estaría: "would be", "he/she/it would be" (Estar, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Su esposa y su hija lo sabrían.
englishTranslation: His wife and his daughter would know it.
vocabIncluded: sabrían: "would know", "they would know" (Saber, conditional, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Su esposo lo sabía y tú lo sabrás también.
englishTranslation: Her husband knew it and you will know it too.
vocabIncluded: sabrás: "will know", "you will know" (Saber, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Su hija *was born* hace tres años.
englishTranslation: Her daughter was born three years ago.

spanishExample: Su padre *clapped* durante *the play.*
englishTranslation: Her father clapped during the play.

spanishExample: Supe que había gente donde estaba mi hermano.
englishTranslation: I found out that there were people where my brother was.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
había: "there was/were" indicating existence (Haber, imperfect, impersonal)
supe: "knew / found out", "I knew / found out" (Saber, preterite, 1st person)
